newsitem.title: USA: Mobil to grow earnings per share 10 pct year.
newsitem.headline: Mobil to grow earnings per share 10 pct year.

text.p: Mobil Corp aims to grow its earnings per share by 10 percent a year through to the year 2001 and increase operating earnings to $5.0 billion a year from $3.2 billion in 1996, based on flat oil prices, chief executive Lucio Noto said on Tuesday.

Noto said in a statement that return on capital employed from 1997 to 2001 would be 14 percent, up from 13.2 percent in 1996 and that the company's target share price was $200, or $100 after a two-for-one share split.
The stock was trading up 1-3/8 after the statement at $123.
"Earnings improvement will be driven by internal initiatives such as volume growth, expense reduction and better performance in all of its businesses," Noto said.
